result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Violation Report Dated: 10/23/22

4:10 PM Defendant Cynthia Lin Scheuwimer appeared by phone.  Attorney Shelley Cupino in court for Cynthia Lin Scheuwimer.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Cupino requesting an adjournment, still needs Discovery in many of Deft's cases and requesting a date in late November/early December.
State has no objection as long as there are no bond issues going forward.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing on December 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:06 AM Defendant Cynthia Lin Scheuwimer appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by phone for Cynthia Lin Scheuwimer.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared in person for State of Wisconsin. State is in compliance w/victim's rights. There is a Day Report filed w/a positive alcohol test. State is requesting a cash bond of $20,000 on this case. Defense is objecting to a cash bond. Court denies the bond motion. Defense has received a global offer and will be reviewing.
Bail/bond hearing on October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bond Based on Day Reporting Performance
Violation Report Dated: 09/12/22
Plea hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:38 PM Defendant Cynthia Lin Scheuwimer appeared by phone.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by phone for Cynthia Lin Scheuwimer.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Atty Cupino still waiting on a global offer.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

9:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cynthia Lin Scheuwimer appeared by phone.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by phone for Cynthia Lin Scheuwimer. 
950/Marsy's Law complied with. 
Defense requesting a new date, has not received a global offer yet. Deft. has recently picked up a new criminal case.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on September 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
PAC Charge added to case.

4:10 PM Defendant Cynthia Lin Scheuwimer appeared by phone.  Attorney Adam T. Stuart appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by phone for Cynthia Lin Scheuwimer. 
950/Marsy's Law complied with. Tracking w/ 22CT31. State requests a increase in cash bond for case 22CT31.
Plea hearing on July 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: 2:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cynthia Lin Scheuwimer in court.  Attorney Shelley Cupino in court for Cynthia Lin Scheuwimer. State will file an amended complaint to CT 1 from OWI 4th to OWI 3rd. Atty Cupino no objections to amendment. Court grants amendment. Atty Cupino rvd' charges with Defendant, waives reading. Court will allow globalization to br. 3
Email correspondence between Court and Counsel
Status conference on June 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

02:03/02:18/04:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Daniel Gabler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cynthia Lin Scheuwimer in court.  Attorney Shelley Cupino in court for Cynthia Lin Scheuwimer. 
Officer Hang sworn and testified, Officer ID's def in Court today. Court will take judicial notice of prior OWI's, State requests cont PH on OWI#4. as OWI 3 is still pending, making this a felony case. Court will recall case this afternoon, Court recalls case 04:37 State has information related to the OWI #4. Court states blood draw cannot be used to increase the penalty. State will file an amended complaint, to prove the OWI #4. Court dismisses Count 1 at this time. 
Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm
